pros: There are lots of opportunities for Professional Development
cons: None that I can think of yet

job_title: Assistant Professor of Mathematics in Hawkins, TX

pros: nice working environment for all emplyees

review_title: Nepotism. Unprofressionalism. Disorganization. DO NOT WORK HERE.
job_title: Enrollment Management Office in Hawkins, TX
pros:
Small school, so you really get to know your students and other staff members. 
Older alums had great experiences which let you know that at some point the school was great.
cons:
Huge lack of resources
President expects results but does not provide tools for employees to be successful
Nepotism at an ALL TIME high --- there are so many people employed here who are related. They meet NONE of the job qualifications. Which plays a role in the overall unsuccess of the College
Employees are treated as though they are disposable
President actually told the entire staff to "unplan their plans" and come in on a Saturday and work 12+ hours with absolutely NO comp time given. 
The vacation time is pitiful
Check out the recruitment vehicles... The red beat up corollas that are never, EVER fixed or equip to be on the road
Mismanagement of funds - example: Artist that came (famous) had to pay for his own gas when he came to Jarvis Fest because the Jarvis Exxon card declined.

pros: Tremendous environment. Students are eager to take instruction. Administration is transparent and fully vested in student success.
cons: Some people who are holdovers from previous administrations harbor bitterness for being passed over for promotions. As with any organization, not everyone is on board for change. President is too nice because he allows those who are very negative and critical remain on staff. I'd fire them for insubordination.

review_title: Plenty of opportunities to give back students and the institution.
pros: Great opportunity to work across multiple divisions. It's such a small school, you can get lots of administrative experience while working as a faculty member.
cons: Located in a microscopic town. Much of the work load is passed off to younger/newer employees.

pros: Jarvis Christian College, is a great place to work. Jarvis, is mission oriented and management truly invest in talent to provide for the best performance outcomes.
cons: I do not have any negative thing to say about  the college. I truly recommend Jarvis, especially young professionals!

review_title: If you are offered a position at Jarvis Christian College (JCC), RUN!
pros: Small social network of faculty and staff.
cons: Poor pay, poor benefits.  Incompetent management at ALL levels.  Crumbling infrastructure.  You will NEVER receive at raise at Jarvis Christian College.  All of the administrators (including the Board of Directors, apparently) are fools!

pros: The HR office is very helpful and friendly.
cons: The payroll office needs to be more professional in dealing with the employee payments.

review_title: Jarvis Christian College is an awful place to work!
cons: Just about everything else--awful salaries and benefits; poor physical facilities; bad management, and on and on and on.  Employees have not had meaningful raises in years!  Job evaluations are done so poorly that they are meaningless.
Getting projects approved for funding and unfair treatment
